str2: Erastus, steward of Corinth, a Christian. From erao; beloved; Erastus, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Trophimus, a Christian of Ephesus in Asia. From trophe; nutritive; Trophimus, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and leipo; to leave behind; by implication, to forsake.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Miletus, a city on the coast of the Roman province Asia. Of uncertain origin; Miletus, a city of Asia Minor.
